A no√ß√£o de transfer√™ncia nos ‚ÄúEstudos sobre a histeria‚Äù (Breuer & Freud, 1895)

title: Liquidity Ratios Analysis - Brazilian Stock Market (B3)
text: This project demonstrates how to extract annual balance sheets from publicly traded companies listed on B3 (Brazilian stock exchange), and to calculate liquidity ratios (current, quick, immediate, and general) from this data, in order to inform investment decisions.

title: Liquidity Ratios Analysis - Brazilian Stock Market (B3)
text: This project demonstrates how to extract annual balance sheets from publicly traded companies listed on B3 (Brazilian stock exchange), and to calculate liquidity ratios (current, quick, immediate, and general) from this data, in order to inform investment decisions.

title: Liquidity Ratios Analysis - Brazilian Stock Market (B3)
text:
Methodology
Using R programming and financial data analysis techniques, this study focuses on four key liquidity ratios:

Current Ratio: Current assets / Current liabilities
Quick Ratio: (Current assets - Inventory) / Current liabilities
Immediate Ratio: Cash and equivalents / Current liabilities
General Ratio: (Current assets + Long-term assets) / (Current + Non-current liabilities)

title: Liquidity Ratios Analysis - Brazilian Stock Market (B3)
text:
Data Extraction and Preparation

# install pacman if it is not installed
if (!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman")

Carregando pacotes exigidos: pacman

# install packages if they are not installed and load them
pacman::p_load(
  tidyverse,
  GetDFPData2,
  janitor,
  here,
  scales,
  ggthemes,
  plotly,
  DT,
  crosstalk,
  htmltools
  )


# store company name
cia_name <- "anima"

# get data
data_info <- get_info_companies()

# subset companies currently traded on B3
info_cleaned <- 
  data_info |>
  clean_names() |>
  rename(
    name_social     = denom_social,
    name_commercial = denom_comerc,
    registro        = sit_reg,
    code_cvm        = cd_cvm,
    sector          = setor_ativ,
    tipo            = tp_merc
    ) |>
  mutate(across(c(registro, tipo, sector), str_to_lower)) |>
  filter(registro == "ativo") |>
  filter(tipo == "bolsa") |>
  mutate(sector = str_remove_all(sector, ".*- "))

# store company sector
cia_sector <- 
  info_cleaned |>
  filter(str_detect(name_social, str_to_upper(cia_name))) |>
  pull(sector)

# store company codes from the same economic sector of company chosen
cvm_codes <- 
  info_cleaned |>
  filter(sector == cia_sector) |>
  pull(code_cvm)

# download balance sheet data
list_bp  <- 
  get_dfp_data(
    companies_cvm_codes = cvm_codes,
    type_docs           = c("BPA","BPP"),
    type_format         = "con",
    clean_data          = TRUE,
    use_memoise         = FALSE,
    cache_folder        = "gdfpd2_cache"
)

title: Liquidity Ratios Analysis - Brazilian Stock Market (B3)
text:
Key Findings

Company Performance vs.¬†Sector Average
The analysis reveals important insights about ANIMA HOLDING S.A. liquidity position:

Current Ratio Trends: Shows the company‚Äôs ability to meet short-term obligations
Quick Ratio Analysis: Excludes inventory to provide a more conservative liquidity measure
Immediate Ratio: Reveals cash position strength for urgent obligations
General Ratio: Provides comprehensive liquidity assessment including long-term assets



Classification System
The visualizations use a color-coded classification system:

üü¢ Adequate (green): Strong liquidity position
üîµ Regular (blue): Acceptable liquidity levels
üü† Concerning (orange): Attention required
üî¥ Critical (red): Immediate attention needed

title: Liquidity Ratios Analysis - Brazilian Stock Market (B3)
text:
Investment Implications
This liquidity analysis provides valuable insights for:

Portfolio managers seeking companies with solid financial foundations
Individual investors evaluating investment safety and company stability
Financial analysts comparing companies within the same economic sector
Risk managers assessing short-term financial risk exposure

title: Liquidity Ratios Analysis - Brazilian Stock Market (B3)
text:
Technical Implementation
Data Sources: B3 (Brazilian Stock Exchange) official financial reports
Analysis Tools: R (tidyverse, GetDFPData2, ggplot2, plotly)
Methodology: Balance sheet analysis with sector benchmarking
Interactivity: Dynamic plots with hover information and classification tooltips
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________
This analysis demonstrates the integration of financial data extraction, statistical analysis, and interactive visualization techniques using R programming. The complete methodology can be adapted for analyzing any publicly traded company on B3.

title: About me
text:
I‚Äôm a psychologist with a master‚Äôs degree, experienced in public health research and financial markets analysis. I use R programming to explore complex data and uncover insights that bridge psychology, health policy, and economic behavior.
My background in psychology, with emphasis on psychoanalysis, has given me a unique perspective on human decision-making ‚Äî something I apply to both health data analysis and financial market studies.

title: About me
text:
I‚Äôm a psychologist with a master‚Äôs degree, experienced in public health research and financial markets analysis. I use R programming to explore complex data and uncover insights that bridge psychology, health policy, and economic behavior.
My background in psychology, with emphasis on psychoanalysis, has given me a unique perspective on human decision-making ‚Äî something I apply to both health data analysis and financial market studies.

title: About me
text:
Areas of work

Public Health
Analysis of population health patterns, epidemiological research, and health policy evaluation. I work with data from the Brazilian public health system (SUS) and other sources to understand trends and inform decisions.


Financial Markets
Investment analysis, market behavior, and economic indicators. Special focus on Brazilian companies listed on B3, using balance sheet and financial statement data.


Data Science
Statistical modeling, data visualization, and predictive analytics. I use the R tidyverse ecosystem to transform raw data into actionable insights.

title: About me
text:
Technical skills

Programming: R (tidyverse, ggplot2, tidymodels, Shiny)
Analysis: Statistical modeling, data visualization, predictive analytics
Tools: Quarto, Git/GitHub, RStudio
Data: API extraction, web scraping, large dataset manipulation

title: About me
text:
Outside of work
When I‚Äôm not analyzing data or studying markets, I enjoy reading about philosophy and history, watching documentaries, and spending time with family. I believe a balanced life contributes to more creative thinking and sharper analysis.

title: Research
text:
The notion of transference in ‚ÄúStudies on hysteria‚Äù (Breuer & Freud, 1895)
Paid√©ia (Ribeir√£o Preto)
This article is part of a larger project examining how the concept of transference is dealt with in Freudian psychoanalysis. As the notion of transference appears for the first time in chapter 4 of ‚ÄúStudies on hysteria‚Äù, this work acquires the status of the starting point for that examination. It verifies that the notion of transference cannot be understood as the whole relationship that a patient establishes with their psychoanalyst. It cannot either be understood as the total perturbation in this type of relationship, as it was later interpreted by other authors. It is only a very specific point of this relationship, in which, through a false bond, and in an uncommon way, the figure of the doctor replaces someone from the patient‚Äôs past.
Paper
